description:
I was installing nova-common and received an error from the deb install process.

Steps:
 * add-apt-repository ppa:nova-core/trunk
 * apt-get install nova-common

nova-common fails with an error. Digging into the post-inst script, I tracked it down to a failure running: "nova-manage db sync".

The traceback on that error in /var/log/nova/nova-manage.log is:


2011-08-11 15:58:20,797 INFO migrate.versioning.api [-] done
2011-08-11 15:58:20,798 INFO migrate.versioning.api [-] 10 -> 11... 
2011-08-11 15:58:20,824 INFO migrate.versioning.api [-] done
2011-08-11 15:58:20,824 INFO migrate.versioning.api [-] 11 -> 12... 
2011-08-11 15:58:20,859 DEBUG migrate.versioning.util [-] Disposing SQLAlchemy engine Engine(sqlite:////var/lib/nova/nova.sqlite) from (pid=22125) with_engine /usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/migrate/versioning/util/__init__.py:163
2011-08-11 15:58:20,860 CRITICAL nova [-] 'module' object has no attribute 'MigrateDeprecationWarning'
(nova): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/bin/nova-manage", line 1520, in <module>
(nova): TRACE:     main()
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/bin/nova-manage", line 1508, in main
(nova): TRACE:     fn(*fn_args, **fn_kwargs)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/bin/nova-manage", line 1000, in sync
(nova): TRACE:     return migration.db_sync(version)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/db/migration.py", line 35, in db_sync
(nova): TRACE:     return IMPL.db_sync(version=version)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py", line 43, in db_sync
(nova): TRACE:     return versioning_api.upgrade(FLAGS.sql_connection, repo_path, version)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/migrate/versioning/api.py", line 185, in upgrade
(nova): TRACE:     return _migrate(url, repository, version, upgrade=True, err=err, **opts)
(nova): TRACE:   File "<string>", line 2, in _migrate
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/migrate/versioning/util/__init__.py", line 160, in with_engine
(nova): TRACE:     return f(*a, **kw)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/migrate/versioning/api.py", line 364, in _migrate
(nova): TRACE:     schema.runchange(ver, change, changeset.step)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/migrate/versioning/schema.py", line 83, in runchange
(nova): TRACE:     change.run(self.engine, step)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/migrate/versioning/script/py.py", line 143, in run
(nova): TRACE:     " parameter (since version > 0.5.4)", exceptions.MigrateDeprecationWarning)
(nova): TRACE: AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'MigrateDeprecationWarning'
(nova): TRACE: 

I tried the same with the milestone PPA, with the same end result.

When I looked at the python packages installed on this host, I have sqlalchemy-migrate==0.6 already installed.
title: nova-common (milestone3, trunk) error on installing on Ubuntu 11.04 Natty

comments.content:
I was installing nova-common and received an error from the deb install process.

Steps:
 * add-apt-repository ppa:nova-core/trunk
 * apt-get install nova-common

nova-common fails with an error. Digging into the post-inst script, I tracked it down to a failure running: "nova-manage db sync".

The traceback on that error in /var/log/nova/nova-manage.log is:


2011-08-11 15:58:20,797 INFO migrate.versioning.api [-] done
2011-08-11 15:58:20,798 INFO migrate.versioning.api [-] 10 -> 11... 
2011-08-11 15:58:20,824 INFO migrate.versioning.api [-] done
2011-08-11 15:58:20,824 INFO migrate.versioning.api [-] 11 -> 12... 
2011-08-11 15:58:20,859 DEBUG migrate.versioning.util [-] Disposing SQLAlchemy engine Engine(sqlite:////var/lib/nova/nova.sqlite) from (pid=22125) with_engine /usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/migrate/versioning/util/__init__.py:163
2011-08-11 15:58:20,860 CRITICAL nova [-] 'module' object has no attribute 'MigrateDeprecationWarning'
(nova): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/bin/nova-manage", line 1520, in <module>
(nova): TRACE:     main()
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/bin/nova-manage", line 1508, in main
(nova): TRACE:     fn(*fn_args, **fn_kwargs)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/bin/nova-manage", line 1000, in sync
(nova): TRACE:     return migration.db_sync(version)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/db/migration.py", line 35, in db_sync
(nova): TRACE:     return IMPL.db_sync(version=version)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py", line 43, in db_sync
(nova): TRACE:     return versioning_api.upgrade(FLAGS.sql_connection, repo_path, version)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/migrate/versioning/api.py", line 185, in upgrade
(nova): TRACE:     return _migrate(url, repository, version, upgrade=True, err=err, **opts)
(nova): TRACE:   File "<string>", line 2, in _migrate
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/migrate/versioning/util/__init__.py", line 160, in with_engine
(nova): TRACE:     return f(*a, **kw)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/migrate/versioning/api.py", line 364, in _migrate
(nova): TRACE:     schema.runchange(ver, change, changeset.step)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/migrate/versioning/schema.py", line 83, in runchange
(nova): TRACE:     change.run(self.engine, step)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/migrate/versioning/script/py.py", line 143, in run
(nova): TRACE:     " parameter (since version > 0.5.4)", exceptions.MigrateDeprecationWarning)
(nova): TRACE: AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'MigrateDeprecationWarning'
(nova): TRACE: 

I tried the same with the milestone PPA, with the same end result.

When I looked at the python packages installed on this host, I have sqlalchemy-migrate==0.6 already installed.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~heckj

comments.content:
This appears to be directly related to an upstream bug on SQLAlchemy - http://code.google.com/p/sqlalchemy-migrate/issues/detail?id=109, specific to version sqlalchemy-migrate 0.6.

It appears to be fixed in sqlalchemy-migrate 0.6.1 and later versions
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~heckj

comments.content: The depending (and conflicting/broken) package that's getting installed with SQLAlchemy 0.6.0 is "python-migrate". Have written maintainer (Jan Dittberner <email address hidden>) to find out how to get this updated to version 0.6.1
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~heckj

comments.content:
pre-installing sqlalchemy-migrate==0.6.1 seems to be viable workaround to the package install.

run "sudo pip install sqlalchemy-migrate==0.6.1" prior to "apt-get install nova-common" and it flows through properly.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~heckj

comments.content: Can't reproduce on either natty or oneiric... nova-manage.log shows migration up to model 36 (with 2011.3~d4~20110818.1452). Anything particular on your setup ? Does that also happen if you install more than nova-common (like, say, nova-api ?)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content:
I started with a freshly installed 11.04 "server" instance. The intention was to build up a nova-compute server to add into an existing cluster.

sudo bash
apt-get update
apt-get -y dist-upgrade
apt-get install -y python-software-properties
add-apt-repository ppa:nova-core/trunk
apt-get update
apt-get install -y nova-compute

Reproducing today (8/18/2011) doesn't exhibit the error - and when I looked, there was a different version of sql-migrate in place:

python-migrate 0.6-4

which doesn't have the error in the python script. So... it looks good to me!

I also verified with ppa:nova-core/milestone on a separate machine.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~heckj

comments.content:
I'll mark it invalid then -- please reopen if you can reproduce.
Note that 0.6-4 is still upstream 0.6 though (the -4 is the debian revision).
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx
